.TH LHA 1 “22 Sept, 1998” “Debian GNU/Linux” “Archiver" .SH NAME

LHa \- LZH un-archiver

.SH SYNOPSIS
.B lha
.B key
[
.B -
]
.B {axelvudmcp}
[
.B qvnfodizg012
]
[
.B w=<dir>
]
.I archive_file
[
.I flie
\&.\|.\|. ]
.br
.B lha
.I archive_file
.SH DESCRIPTION

The

.B lha
program displays or extracts the contents of a LZH archive.

For a list of commands, please refer to the executable. It will

display a list of valid commands and modifiers if you omit any parameter.

.TP
commands:

EXtract from archive

List / Verbose List

Update newer files to archive

Delete from archive

Move to archive (means ‘ad’)

re-Construct new archive

Print to STDOUT from archive

Test file CRC in archive

.TP
options:
quiet verbose not execute force (over write at extract)

FILES are TEXT file

use LHarc compatible method (a/u) specify extract directory (x/e) delete FILES after (a/u/c) ignore directory path (x/e) files not compress (a/u) [Generic] format (for compatibility) header level (a/u)

TEXT code convert from/to EUC

filename multibyte convert

.SH BUGS

This manpage is poor, it really should be improved, but the original

is in Japanese.
